prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
5 sigma signal to noise ratio requested on flux density; see proposal text for details.
The object being examined is a point source, so strictly speaking no angular resolution is required. A value of 1" was put in as place-holder value, but does not affect the observing setup desired.

Alpha Cen is a binary, with the separation of the two components estimated to be a few arcseconds apart in 2015. The desired 0.6 arcsecond angular resolution is to ensure that the two components are separated.
Other comments in the Technical Justification section for science goal Alpha Cen 100 GHz also apply here.

Alpha Cen is a binary, with the separation of the two components estimated to be a few arcsecondes apart in 2015. The desired 0.6 arcsecond angular resolution is to ensure that the two components are separated.
Other comments in the Technical Justification section of Alpha Cen 100 GHz are applicable here too.

5 sigma signal to noise ratio requested on flux density; see proposal text for details.
The object being examined is a point source, so strictly speaking no angular resolution is required. A value of 1" was put in as place-holder value, but does not affect the observing setup desired.
Choice of continuum frequencies is not stringent; the values put into the OT were chosen to reproduce the values used in the calculations in the proposal scientific justification.

10 sigma SNR requested.
Other comments from the Technical Justification section of the Tau Ceti 100 GHz science goal also apply here.

5 sigma SNR
Other comments from the Technical Justification section of the science goal Tau Ceti 100 GHZ also apply here.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Solar-like stars have chromospheres, transition regions, and coronae which indicate non-radiative heating processes occurring in their outer atmospheres. These processes are presumed to be magnetic in nature, and alter the structure of the plasma in the outer stellar atmosphere. The nearest solar-like stars can place our Sun in context by offering a complementary view of the stellar atmospheric structure for stars of differing magnetic activity levels. This proposal is motivated by recent results detecting the far-IR/sub-mm and FUV continuum of the nearest solar-like star, alpha Cen A, as useful tools of the stellar atmosphere. We seek sensitive ALMA observations in 3 bands (3, 6, 8) of the two nearest solar-like stars, Alpha Cen A and Tau Ceti, to probe their atmospheric structures. A comparison with updated dynamic chromospheric models will reveal the contribution of magnetic heating from different structures.
